AcceptAdministratorInvitation.description: The following example demonstrates how an account can accept an invitation from the Security Hub administrator account to be a member account. This operation is applicable only to member accounts that are not added through AWS Organizations.
AcceptAdministratorInvitation.title: To accept an invitation be a member account

BatchDeleteAutomationRules.description: The following example deletes the specified automation rules.
BatchDeleteAutomationRules.title: To delete one or more automation rules

BatchDisableStandards.description: The following example disables a security standard in Security Hub.
BatchDisableStandards.title: To disable one or more security standards

BatchEnableStandards.description: The following example enables the security standard specified by the StandardArn. You can use this operation to enable one or more Security Hub standards.
BatchEnableStandards.title: To enable security standards

Type.Value: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards

BatchGetAutomationRules.description: The following example updates the specified automation rules.
BatchGetAutomationRules.title: To update one ore more automation rules

SecurityControls.Description: This AWS control checks whether ACM Certificates in your account are marked for expiration within a specified time period. Certificates provided by ACM are automatically renewed. ACM does not automatically renew certificates that you import.
SecurityControls.Title: Imported and ACM-issued certificates should be renewed after a specified time period

SecurityControls.Description: This control checks whether all stages of Amazon API Gateway REST and WebSocket APIs have logging enabled. The control fails if logging is not enabled for all methods of a stage or if loggingLevel is neither ERROR nor INFO.
SecurityControls.Title: API Gateway REST and WebSocket API execution logging should be enabled

BatchGetSecurityControls.description: The following example gets details for the specified controls in the current AWS account and AWS Region.
BatchGetSecurityControls.title: To get security control details

StandardsControlAssociationDetails.StandardsControlDescription: AWS CloudTrail is a web service that records AWS API calls for your account and delivers log files to you. The recorded information includes the identity of the API caller, the time of the API call, the source IP address of the API caller, the request parameters, and the response elements returned by the AWS service.
StandardsControlAssociationDetails.StandardsControlTitle: Ensure CloudTrail is enabled in all regions

StandardsControlAssociationDetails.StandardsControlDescription: Real-time monitoring of API calls can be achieved by directing CloudTrail Logs to CloudWatch Logs and establishing corresponding metric filters and alarms. Network gateways are required to send/receive traffic to a destination outside of a VPC. It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for changes to network gateways.
StandardsControlAssociationDetails.StandardsControlTitle: Ensure a log metric filter and alarm exist for changes to network gateways

BatchGetStandardsControlAssociations.description: The following example retrieves the enablement status of the specified controls in the specified standards.
BatchGetStandardsControlAssociations.title: To get enablement status of a batch of controls

BatchImportFindings.description: The following example imports findings from a third party provider to Security Hub.
BatchImportFindings.title: To import security findings from a third party provider to Security Hub

BatchUpdateAutomationRules.description: The following example updates the specified automation rules.
BatchUpdateAutomationRules.title: To update one ore more automation rules

Note.Text: Known issue that is not a risk.

BatchUpdateFindings.description: The following example updates Security Hub findings. The finding identifier parameter specifies which findings to update. Only specific finding fields can be updated with this operation.
BatchUpdateFindings.title: To update Security Hub findings

BatchUpdateStandardsControlAssociations.description: The following example disables CloudWatch.12 in CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.2.0. The example returns an error for CloudTrail.1 because an invalid standard ARN is provided.
BatchUpdateStandardsControlAssociations.title: To update enablement status of a batch of controls

input.Description: Action to send the finding for remediation tracking
input.Name: Send to remediation

CreateActionTarget.description: The following example creates a custom action target in Security Hub. Custom actions on findings and insights automatically trigger actions in Amazon CloudWatch Events.
CreateActionTarget.title: To create a custom action target

Note.Text: This is a critical S3 bucket, please look into this ASAP

input.Description: Elevate finding severity to Critical for important resources

CreateAutomationRule.description: The following example creates an automation rule.
CreateAutomationRule.title: To create an automation rule

CreateFindingAggregator.description: The following example creates a finding aggregator. This is required to enable cross-Region aggregation.
CreateFindingAggregator.title: To enable cross-Region aggregation

CreateInsight.description: The following example creates a custom insight in Security Hub. An insight is a collection of findings that relate to a security issue.
CreateInsight.title: To create a custom insight

CreateMembers.description: The following example creates a member association between the specified accounts and the administrator account (the account that makes the request). This operation is used to add accounts that aren't part of an organization.
CreateMembers.title: To add a member account

DeclineInvitations.description: The following example declines an invitation from the Security Hub administrator account to become a member account. The invited account makes the request.
DeclineInvitations.title: To decline invitation to become a member account

DeleteActionTarget.description: The following example deletes a custom action target that triggers target actions in Amazon CloudWatch Events. Deleting a custom action target doesn't affect findings or insights that were already sent to CloudWatch Events based on the custom action.
DeleteActionTarget.title: To delete a custom action target

DeleteFindingAggregator.description: The following example deletes a finding aggregator in Security Hub. Deleting the finding aggregator stops cross-Region aggregation. This operation produces no output.
DeleteFindingAggregator.title: To delete a finding aggregator

DeleteInsight.description: The following example deletes a custom insight in Security Hub.
DeleteInsight.title: To delete a custom insight

DeleteInvitations.description: The following example deletes an invitation sent by the Security Hub administrator account to a prospective member account. This operation is used only for invitations sent to accounts that aren't part of an organization. Organization accounts don't receive invitations.
DeleteInvitations.title: To delete a custom insight

DeleteMembers.description: The following example deletes the specified member account from Security Hub. This operation can be used to delete member accounts that are part of an organization or that were invited manually.
DeleteMembers.title: To delete a member account

ActionTargets.Description: Action to send the finding for remediation tracking
ActionTargets.Name: Send to remediation

DescribeActionTargets.description: The following example returns a list of custom action targets. You use custom actions on findings and insights in Security Hub to trigger target actions in Amazon CloudWatch Events.
DescribeActionTargets.title: To return custom action targets

DescribeHub.description: The following example returns details about the Hub resource in the calling account. The Hub resource represents the implementation of  the AWS Security Hub service in the calling account.
DescribeHub.title: To return details about Hub resource

DescribeOrganizationConfiguration.description: The following example returns details about the way in which AWS Organizations is configured for a Security Hub account that belongs to an organization. Only a Security Hub administrator account can call this operation.
DescribeOrganizationConfiguration.title: To get information about Organizations configuration

Products.Description: CrowdStrike Falcon's single lightweight sensor unifies next-gen antivirus, endpoint detection and response, and 24/7 managed hunting, via the cloud.

DescribeProducts.description: The following example returns details about AWS services and third-party products that Security Hub integrates with.
DescribeProducts.title: To get information about Security Hub integrations

Standards.Description: The AWS Foundational Security Best Practices standard is a set of automated security checks that detect when AWS accounts and deployed resources do not align to security best practices. The standard is defined by AWS security experts. This curated set of controls helps improve your security posture in AWS, and cover AWS's most popular and foundational services.
Standards.Name: AWS Foundational Security Best Practices v1.0.0

Standards.Description: The Center for Internet Security (CIS) AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.2.0 is a set of security configuration best practices for AWS. This Security Hub standard automatically checks for your compliance readiness against a subset of CIS requirements.
Standards.Name: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.2.0

Standards.Description: The Center for Internet Security (CIS) AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0 is a set of security configuration best practices for AWS. This Security Hub standard automatically checks for your compliance readiness against a subset of CIS requirements.
Standards.Name: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0

Standards.Description: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) v3.2.1 is an information security standard for entities that store, process, and/or transmit cardholder data. This Security Hub standard automatically checks for your compliance readiness against a subset of PCI DSS requirements.
Standards.Name: PCI DSS v3.2.1

DescribeStandards.description: The following example returns a list of available security standards in Security Hub.
DescribeStandards.title: To get available Security Hub standards

Controls.Description: This AWS control checks whether your Auto Scaling groups that are associated with a load balancer are using Elastic Load Balancing health checks.
Controls.Title: Auto scaling groups associated with a load balancer should use health checks

Controls.Description: This control checks for the CloudWatch metric filters using the following pattern { $.userIdentity.type = "Root" && $.userIdentity.invokedBy NOT EXISTS && $.eventType != "AwsServiceEvent" } It checks that the log group name is configured for use with active multi-region CloudTrail, that there is at least one Event Selector for a Trail with IncludeManagementEvents set to true and ReadWriteType set to All, and that there is at least one active subscriber to an SNS topic associated with the alarm.
Controls.Title: A log metric filter and alarm should exist for usage of the "root" user

DescribeStandardsControls.description: The following example returns a list of security controls and control details that apply to a specified security standard. The list includes controls that are enabled and disabled in the standard.
DescribeStandardsControls.title: To get a list of controls for a security standard

DisableImportFindingsForProduct.description: The following example ends an integration between Security Hub and the specified product that sends findings to Security Hub. After the integration ends, the product no longer sends findings to Security  Hub.
DisableImportFindingsForProduct.title: To end a Security Hub integration

DisableOrganizationAdminAccount.description: The following example removes the Security Hub administrator account in the Region from which the operation was executed. This operation doesn't remove the delegated administrator account in AWS Organizations.
DisableOrganizationAdminAccount.title: To remove a Security Hub administrator account

DisableSecurityHub.description: The following example deactivates Security Hub for the current account and Region.
DisableSecurityHub.title: To deactivate Security Hub

DisassociateFromAdministratorAccount.description: The following example dissociates the requesting account from its associated administrator account.
DisassociateFromAdministratorAccount.title: To disassociate requesting account from administrator account

DisassociateMembers.description: The following example dissociates the specified member accounts from the associated administrator account.
DisassociateMembers.title: To disassociate member accounts from administrator account

EnableImportFindingsForProduct.description: The following example activates an integration between Security Hub and a third party partner product that sends findings to Security Hub.
EnableImportFindingsForProduct.title: To activate an integration

EnableOrganizationAdminAccount.description: The following example designates the specified account as the Security Hub administrator account. The requesting account must be the organization management account.
EnableOrganizationAdminAccount.title: To designate a Security Hub administrator

EnableSecurityHub.description: The following example activates the Security Hub service in the requesting AWS account. The service is activated in the current AWS Region or the Region that you specify in the request. Some standards are automatically turned on in your account unless you opt out. To determine which standards are automatically turned on, see the Security Hub documentation.
EnableSecurityHub.title: To activate Security Hub

GetAdministratorAccount.description: The following example provides details about the Security Hub administrator account for the requesting member account.
GetAdministratorAccount.title: To get details about the Security Hub administrator account

GetEnabledStandards.description: The following example returns a list of Security Hub standards that are currently enabled in your account.
GetEnabledStandards.title: To return a list of enabled standards

GetFindingAggregator.description: The following example returns cross-Region aggregation details for the requesting account.
GetFindingAggregator.title: To get cross-Region aggregation details

GetFindingHistory.description: The following example retrieves the history of the specified finding during the specified time frame. If the time frame permits, Security Hub returns finding history for the last 90 days.
GetFindingHistory.title: To get finding history

Findings.Description: This AWS control checks whether AWS CloudTrail is configured to use the server side encryption (SSE) AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) customer master key (CMK) encryption. The check will pass if the KmsKeyId is defined.

Types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards

Recommendation.Text: For directions on how to correct this issue, consult the AWS Security Hub controls documentation.

Findings.Title: CloudTrail should have encryption at-rest enabled
Types: Software and Configuration Checks/Industry and Regulatory Standards

GetFindings.description: The following example returns a filtered and sorted list of Security Hub findings.
GetFindings.title: To get a list of findings

GetInsightResults.description: The following example returns the results of the Security Hub insight specified by the insight ARN.
GetInsightResults.title: To get the results of a Security Hub insight

GetInsights.description: The following example returns details of the Security Hub insight with the specified ARN.
GetInsights.title: To get details of a Security Hub insight

GetInvitationsCount.description: The following example returns a count of invitations that the Security Hub administrator sent to the current member account, not including the currently accepted invitation.
GetInvitationsCount.title: To get a count of membership invitations

GetMembers.description: The following example returns details for the Security Hub member accounts with the specified AWS account IDs. An administrator account may be the delegated Security Hub administrator account for an organization or an administrator account that enabled Security Hub manually. The Security Hub administrator must call this operation.
GetMembers.title: To get member account details

InviteMembers.description: The following example invites the specified AWS accounts to become member accounts associated with the calling Security Hub administrator account. You only use this operation to invite accounts that don't belong to an AWS Organizations organization.
InviteMembers.title: To invite accounts to become members

AutomationRulesMetadata.Description: IAM.8 is a known issue and can be resolved
Lambda.2 is a known issue and can be resolved

ListAutomationRules.description: The following example lists automation rules and rule metadata in the calling account.
ListAutomationRules.title: To list automation rules

ListEnabledProductsForImport.description: The following example returns a list of subscription Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) for the product integrations that you have currently enabled in Security Hub.
ListEnabledProductsForImport.title: To list ARNs for enabled integrations

ListFindingAggregators.description: The following example disables the specified control in the specified security standard.
ListFindingAggregators.title: To update the enablement status of a standard control

ListInvitations.description: The following example returns a list of Security Hub member invitations sent to the calling AWS account. Only accounts that are invited manually use this operation. It's not for use by accounts that are managed through AWS Organizations.
ListInvitations.title: To list membership invitations to calling account

ListMembers.description: The following example returns details about member accounts for the calling Security Hub administrator account. The response includes member accounts that are managed through AWS Organizations and those that were invited manually.
ListMembers.title: To list member account details

ListOrganizationAdminAccounts.description: The following example lists the Security  Hub administrator accounts for an organization. Only the organization management account can call this operation.
ListOrganizationAdminAccounts.title: To list administrator acccounts for an organization

SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This AWS control checks whether ACM Certificates in your account are marked for expiration within a specified time period. Certificates provided by ACM are automatically renewed. ACM does not automatically renew certificates that you import.
SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: Imported and ACM-issued certificates should be renewed after a specified time period

SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether all stages of Amazon API Gateway REST and WebSocket APIs have logging enabled. The control fails if logging is not enabled for all methods of a stage or if loggingLevel is neither ERROR nor INFO.
SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: API Gateway REST and WebSocket API execution logging should be enabled

SecurityControlDefinitions.Description: This control checks whether Amazon API Gateway REST API stages have SSL certificates configured that backend systems can use to authenticate that incoming requests are from the API Gateway.
SecurityControlDefinitions.Title: API Gateway REST API stages should be configured to use SSL certificates for backend authentication

ListSecurityControlDefinitions.description: The following example lists security controls that apply to a specified Security Hub standard.
ListSecurityControlDefinitions.title: To list security controls that apply to a standard

StandardsControlAssociationSummaries.StandardsControlDescription: This AWS control checks whether the following public access block settings are configured from account level: ignorePublicAcls: True, blockPublicPolicy: True, blockPublicAcls: True, restrictPublicBuckets: True.
StandardsControlAssociationSummaries.StandardsControlTitle: S3 Block Public Access setting should be enabled

StandardsControlAssociationSummaries.StandardsControlDescription: This AWS control checks whether the following public access block settings are configured from account level: ignorePublicAcls: True, blockPublicPolicy: True, blockPublicAcls: True, restrictPublicBuckets: True.
StandardsControlAssociationSummaries.StandardsControlTitle: S3 Block Public Access setting should be enabled

ListStandardsControlAssociations.description: The following example specifies whether a control is currently enabled or disabled in each enabled standard in the calling account. The response also provides other details about the control.
ListStandardsControlAssociations.title: To say whether standard

ListTagsForResource.description: The following example returns a list of tags associated with the specified resource.
ListTagsForResource.title: To get a list of tags for a resource

TagResource.description: The following example adds the 'Department' and 'Area' tags to the specified resource.
TagResource.title: To tag a resource

UntagResource.description: The following example removes the 'Department' tag from the specified resource.
UntagResource.title: To remove tags from a resource

input.Description: Sends specified findings to customer service chat
input.Name: Chat custom action

UpdateActionTarget.description: The following example updates the name and description of a custom action target in Security Hub. You can create custom actions to automatically respond to Security Hub findings using Amazon EventBridge.
UpdateActionTarget.title: To update the name and description of a custom action target

UpdateFindingAggregator.description: The following example updates the cross-Region aggregation configuration. You use this operation to change the list of linked Regions and the treatment of new Regions. However, you cannot use this operation to change the aggregation Region.
UpdateFindingAggregator.title: To update cross-Region aggregation settings

UpdateInsight.description: The following example updates the specified Security Hub insight.
UpdateInsight.title: To update an insight

UpdateOrganizationConfiguration.description: The following example updates the configuration for an organization so that Security Hub is automatically activated for new member accounts. Only the Security Hub administrator account can call this operation.
UpdateOrganizationConfiguration.title: To update organization configuration

UpdateSecurityHubConfiguration.description: The following example updates Security Hub settings to turn on consolidated control findings, and to automatically enable new controls in enabled standards.
UpdateSecurityHubConfiguration.title: To update Security Hub settings

UpdateStandardsControl.description: The following example disables the specified control in the specified security standard.
UpdateStandardsControl.title: To update the enablement status of a standard control
